title: Comparative Analysis of Clinical Practice Curricula Based on the 4C/ID Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Knowledge and Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: Structuring learning activities using smartphones in resource-constrained technological environments

learning_goals: The four components of the 4C/ID model (learning objectives, learning tasks, supportive information, procedural information) can be applied to clinical practice education design
Structural differences between domestic and international clinical practice curricula can be comparatively analyzed from a 4C/ID model perspective
Project-based assessment designs can be implemented to enhance practical skills in mobile microlearning environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
